results.title: Head of People (Maternity Cover)
results.description:
Head of People (Maternity Cover, 9 Month Fixed Term Contract)

About Titanbay

At Titanbay, we believe in the power of private market returns. Our investment platform enables institutional and private investors to invest in top-tier private equity, venture capital and real estate funds with low minimums and low fees. With our portfolio construction tools, investors can build sophisticated private equity allocations with unparalleled insight. Titanbay is run and supported by private equity professionals and industry veterans from leading companies including Oaktree, EQT, Hg, Bain, Capital Group, Blackstone and J.P. Morgan.

 

Titanbay has had a phenomenal first couple of years, bringing a selection of some of the world’s top Private Equity managers and strategies onto our platform.

 

We’re seeking to appoint a People Manager as part of a 9 Month Maternity Cover position. As Head of People you will lead an existing team and continue working towards our goal of best practice, embedding positive values and behaviours across the business.

 

What you’ll be doing:
  • Review, develop and own our HR processes and procedures including performance and employee relations issues.
  • Support the development and Growth of the People team
  • Own the entire employee lifecycle from onboarding to exit
  • Implement an effective performance appraisal system that aligns with business’ objectives and key results and encourages employees to develop and grow their careers
  • Maximise employee engagement by developing and implementing new initiatives, encouraging 360 feedback and creating an effective quarterly employee engagement survey and developing solutions to any issues that arise
  • Develop effective cross functional communications which allow ideas and suggestions to be shared
  • Build and promote our D&I initiatives alongside our Talent Team.
  • Continually strive to build a culture focused on well-being and drive and implement initiatives which support our core values.
  • Develop and deliver 1:1 sessions for managers on a variety of subjects to upskill line managers.

Requirements

  • 5 years experience as a people leader within a fast growing start-up and/or scale up environment
  • A strong understanding of team cultures and needs with the ability to identify areas of improvement
  • Experience creating and implementing robust HR processes and procedures
  • Knowledge of effectively driving D&I initiatives
  • Strong relationship-building skills with employees of all levels as well as senior leadership teams
  • Proven leadership skills with the ability to mentor and coach junior members of the team while also driving own performance
  • Prior involvement in organisational design and strategy with the ability to manage shifting priorities and work on multiple initiatives in a challenging and fast paced environment.
  • Critical thinking skills – able to balance complex situations and deliver solutions. Able to blend both established processes/procedures and creative solutions
  • High level organisational skills – able to juggle numerous workstreams and deliver to deadlines
  • Ethical - building trust and commitment and avoiding discrimination

Benefits

  • 28 days holiday p/a + Bank holidays - with the option to roll up to 3 days p/a
  • Remote first company with access to London offices
  • Annual Company offsite
  • Private Health insurance for you and your family
  • Private Dental cover for you and your family
  • Company pension
  • Life Insurance, 3x salary and EAP scheme
  • On-demand digital support for new or expectant parents via Dearbump
  • WeVee Electric Car Scheme

 

Titanbay does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

results.title: Recruiter – Attorneys (Partners & Groups)
results.description:
Offit Kurman is an Am Law 200 firm with 18 offices and approximately 280 attorneys. We are searching for a results driven attorney recruiter with a proven track record of successfully screening and placing partner level and lateral group candidates.

This recruiter will be responsible for account management of agency recruiter relationships to promote submission of partner and lateral group candidates as well as screening candidates received and providing recommendations to senior management. This individual will also be responsible for facilitating new agency relationships, participating in networking activities, and developing marketing strategies to further promote Offit Kurman across various regions.

Key Duties:

  • Manage, nurture, and facilitate 3rd party recruiting agency relationships, including contract negotiation, fee agreements, and serving as the main point of contact for agency partners.
  • Conduct initial interviews with attorney candidates to assess qualifications and fit within the firm.
  • Deliver robust notes and feedback on candidates to stakeholders within the firm.
  • Maintain an efficient and replenishing candidate pipeline specific to partner level candidates

Must have 3+ years of attorney recruiting experience from a law firm or recruiting company. The person hired can sit at any one of our offices. We will also consider remote candidates.

results.title: People Process Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Hello, we're UW 

We’re a bunch of great people working together, solving problems and having fun. Together, we strive to find solutions to help the great people around us get on with the things that matter in life.

How? It’s simple, we take the headache out of essential home services by providing them n one place – energy, broadband, mobile, and even insurance.  That’s one provider, one account, one bill, and lots of savings.

We’re a truly unique FTSE 250 company with a business model that has a aneal social impact at the heart of it. Being a part of the UW community you’ll join a working environment like no other - one where everyone matters - be it our customers, our partners or you, our people.

About the role 

Due to our business growth, we are looking for a new People (HR) Process Manager to join our People Team. 

The role will maintain and improve the processes for employees, outsourced contractors and international workers. You will be responsible for auditing, reviewing, monitoring and setting up processes in the People department. You will liaise with other people and business departments to enhance and improve the efficiency and delivery of services. 

The successful candidate will also be part of a broader the wider People Team and will have the opportunity to be part of the regular weekly and monthly meetings and socials. 

What you'll do 

  • Create, develop and audit efficient processes for onboarding, induction, employment changes and offboarding across diverse working populations, employees, contractors, outsourced workers and international workers. Working with stakeholders across the business who need to contribute towards these processes, or require an output, to ensure they understand their responsibilities through the processes and that their needs are being met.
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for reward, helping with salary banding and benchmarking data collection;
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for talent review and recognition processes;
  • Create, maintain and audit efficient processes for absence management;
  • Create and maintain process documentation for audit and monitoring purposes, providing feedback to the appropriate people and teams on their consistencinof following the processes;
  • Help maintain records and data and perform quality checks for people systems and associated processes;
  • Build strong relationships with those teams responsible for delivering the processes (including People Operations, Recruitment, EUX, Facilities, etc.) to ensure they are kept up to date with any changes and provide feedback on how their teams are delivering against them.

About you

  • A background in HR/People Operations and experience with building operational HR/People processes;
  • A good understanding of HR/People processes and the roles and responsibilities that different teams have in delivering them; 
  • Great at problem-solving - not afraid to think outside the box to get a solution that works for UW;
  • Experience in a fast-paced, scale-up environment;
  • Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail;
  • Comfortable with using HRIS and/or Payroll Systems;
  • Experience in using Google Suite and/or Excel to manipulate and analyse data;
  • A willingness and genuine interest in learning;
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), with a friendly and approachable attitude, and strong teamwork skills;
  • Excellent organisational, and time management skills and ability to prioritise own workload;
  • Ability to perform tasks under pressure and balance many tasks simultaneously;
  • Motivation to get stuck in with new projects;
  • Flexibility and adaptability – the responsibilities and priorities for this role may changeregularlys!

 

What's it in for you?

Join a high-growth FTSE 250 business and help us achieve our ambitions whilst learning and having fun. Become part of a fantastic business culture where people are at the heart of everything we do.

 

  • Huge opportunities for exposure & development as we scale up
  • A competitive salary 
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays
  • Life Insurance up to 4 x your salary
  • Discounted healthcare and medical cash plans including a free Virtual GP service
  • Private pension scheme
  • Share options and Save As You Earn Scheme
  • A range of Health & well-being benefits including a confidential Employee Assistance Programme, Virtual fitness classes and wellness tools
  • Discounts on UW products & services 

 

Apply here!  

 

If you think this is the role for you and want to be part of UW’s extraordinary growth, apply now. 



Job Description



Qualifications



Additional Information
 

We provide equal opportunities, a diverse and inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone. You are welcome to apply no matter your age, disability, gender, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity status, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation.

Please note, if you are applying for a role which involves having access to personal data, you will be subject to a background check. results.title: Web3 People Operations Coordinator
results.description:
We are ClubRare - The World's first community-centered Physical NFT marketplace for collectors. We connect the Real-world and the Metaverse. We are a community for people who trade the things we love.

We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. As a distributed company, we embrace a diverse and inclusive culture that transcends geographical borders. Our team members come from all over the world and bring a rich array of experiences, perspectives, and lifestyles to the team. We believe that this diversity enhances our creativity, collaboration, and innovation, and enables us to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.

We are deeply committed to fostering a culture of empathy, integrity, strategic thinking, innovation, leadership, and performance. These values drive everything we do, from the way we interact with our customers and partners, to the way we develop and deliver our products and services. It's our shared values that give us the strength and drive to become the open metaverse for collectors.

What’s in It for You?

  • Be a vital member of a cutting-edge project and take your career to the next level.
  • Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, and be part of a team that shares your values and has a clear vision.
  • Have the chance to shape the future of an innovative new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.
  • Get hands-on experience with the latest tech and systems, and challenge yourself to learn and grow.
  • Play an active role in one of the most significant technological innovations in human history.
  • Be compensated with a competitive salary paid in crypto for your dedication and efforts.

Your Impact

In this role, you will have the opportunity to get involved in all aspects of People Operations and will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and development of the organization.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a proactive and hands-on approach, attention to detail, and a passion for learning about and staying up-to-date on the latest trends in Web3 and NFTs. This is a part-time role with the potential to transition to a full-time position in the future. If you are a motivated and organized individual with a keen interest in the intersection of technology and HR, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

As a People Operations Coordinator, your responsibilities will include:

  • Designing and implementing processes such as onboarding, employee and manager feedback cycles, recruiting, and interviewing.
  • Developing and continuously improving HR policies and processes, including tools/systems and operational guides.
  • Taking ownership of employee queries and using critical thinking to identify and resolve root causes.
  • Documenting and maintaining process procedures for the People Operations team and creating self-service resources for all employees.
  • Managing semi-monthly and monthly payrolls accurately and efficiently.
  • Working with a high level of autonomy and cross-functionally to ensure all employees have the support and resources they need to succeed.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in People Operations, with a track record of success in supporting and scaling HR and Recruiting functions and processes.
  • A demonstrated passion for staying at the forefront of technology and innovation, with a minimum of 1 year of experience in a Web3 or start-up company.
  • Excellent English language skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.
  • A proactive, "can-do" attitude and a willingness to take on new challenges.
  • Experience working with high-performing teams and a track record of contributing to team success.
  • A tech-savvy mindset and attention to detail, with the ability to navigate and adapt to new systems and tools.
  • The ability to handle sensitive and critical information, conversations, and situations with compassion and discretion.

Discover more about ClubRare and what we stand for by visiting our website at www.clubrare.xyz


We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all. As an equal-opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity is a source of strength and all qualified candidates will be given equal consideration for employment at ClubRare.

results.title: People Ops Assistant
results.description:
About ZigZag Global

If you’ve made an online return with Zara, Selfridges or boohoo there’s a good chance you’ve already been introduced to our award-winning SaaS platform. We’re an eCommerce returns business, that has been on a mission to build the best retail returns and post-purchase solution since 2015. Today, hundreds of companies across 130 countries use the ZigZag platform to help reduce the cost, friction, and impact of returns.

We’re passionate about streamlining the returns and post-purchase experience for our clients and their customers. Helping our clients to become more sustainable and profitable in the process.

In March 2021, ZigZag was acquired by Global Blue, an industry leader in tax free shopping. Strengthening our reach across the global retail industry and allowing us to continue to do what we do best, help retailers manage and re-sell their returns.

We believe we have the chance to genuinely challenge and disrupt the industry, so come and join the ambitious and caring team determined to build the world’s most innovative, and helpful returns experience possible.

 

About the People Team

Our UK People team is newly formed and this role will be the second member of the team. We’re passionate about ensuring every employee at ZigZag has the best possible employee experience. We’re here to support employees – they’re our clients!

This is a great time to be joining the team as we’re in the process of building out all our processes and establishing the function. You’ll have the opportunity to help shape our processes, philosophies and culture.

Requirements

This role is part-time and the equivalent of 3 days (24 hours) a week and we're flexible about when those hours are worked throughout the week.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Employee Lifecycle

  • Manage all employee life-cycle processes including, onboarding, benefits, probation and offboarding
  • Ensure all right to work checks are completed and up to date
  • Issue all employee documentation, including contracts and amendment letters
  • Support the administration of company benefits
  • Support with the running of our review cycles, such a performance reviews and salary reviews
  • Support with employment relations cases and processes
  • Help to create and maintain all People & Culture policies and philosophies, touching on all aspects on the employee journey
  • Support with creating, rolling out and managing culture and culture change initiatives, ensuring we are being intentional about harnessing and preserving our great working culture as we grow

 

Support for Employees

  • Be the first point of contact for employees, providing day-to-day support for any queries or concerns they may have around pay, policies and process etc.
  • Listen to employees, collecting their feedback on culture and processes, suggesting ways in which we can improve based on these
  • Support employees in the visa application process
  • Constantly looking to improving our workflows and processes, making full use of our HRIS and other tools to help automate processes
  • Build and produce reports to keep track of people metrics
  • Produce and upload reports for salary benchmarking

 

People Data and Reporting

  • Maintain our HRIS, HiBoB ensuring our is always up to date and employees files and documentation
  • Constantly looking to improving our workflows and processes, making full use of our HRIS and other tools to help automate processes
  • Produce and upload reports for salary benchmarking
  • Build and produce reports to keep track of people metrics
  •  
  •  

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • 1-2 years previous experience in HR or People Ops
  • Genuinely care about people and their employment experience
  • Ability to take initiative, be autonomous and get stuff done
  • A positive and solution focused approach to problem solving
  • Ability to work well with ambiguity and turn ideas into practical processes and clear philosophies
  • Emotional intelligence and the ability to treat difficult conversations and sensitive situations with care
  • A sincere and professional approach, always being honest, ethical and fair
  • Great communication skills – one of our key roles as people team is to build trust and deliver clear and consistent messaging to employees of all levels

Benefits

  • 24 days holidays + bank holidays + additional day holiday after every full year of service (up to 5 additional days)
  • Flexible work options – fully remote or hybrid options – depending on your location (our office hub is in London)
  • Flexible working hours – to provide work life balance
  • Pension Plan
  • BUPA Private Medical Insurance
  • Employee referral bonus scheme

results.title: Global Corporate Recruiter
results.description:
Spacewell is hiring an enthusiastic Global Corporate Recruiter. Your local office will be located at Wilrijk (Antwerp) and you will be in charge of the recruitment for the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Sweden.

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You open your computer and check your mailbox. You received 5 new CVs from potential candidates that applied on our LinkedIn post. What a great start of this day!
  • 9 AM: You review all the CVs to have a good idea of the potential candidates. After doing a deep dive and taking into account the requirements, you narrow your pipeline to 3 candidates.
  • 9:30 AM: You call these 3 potential candidates one by one to do a phone screening and invite them for a HR interview to get to know them better.
  • 11.00 AM: You reach out to your French colleagues to discuss a new vacancy description and priorities. Afterwards you will publish the vacancy on relevant channels.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You have your weekly HR meeting with our colleagues from The Netherlands to get up to date on the latest HR changes and HR strategy.
  • 14:30 PM: You are meeting an interesting candidate for the open position within sales. Afterwards you reach out to the hiring manager to share your feedback and discuss the next steps.  
  • 4 PM:  You have a call with our colleagues in Sweden to ask some urgent questions regarding the format of a new contract and check the local regulations.

Furthermore, as Global Corporate Recruiter you will also contribute to innovative recruitment strategies and critically observe the job market. Next to that, thinking creatively about which resources and channels would make our recruitment a success, is definitely a must have. You will be the center of the entire recruitment journey and experience,  starting from the creation of international vacancy descriptions to the onboarding of new employees.

What about the team?

As a Global Corporate Recruiter, you are the point of contact within the HR team for the recruitment journey from A to Z. You will recruit for different countries, which includes the Netherlands, Belgium, France and Sweden. Together with your international HR team, you will tackle topics like employee administration, implementation of an HRIS, recruitment, onboarding, retention, learning & development, CSR, vitality, a diverse range of legal topics…

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 4 years of working experience as a recruiter.
  • You have a broad knowledge about a diverse range of labour markets, employment communication and innovative recruitment strategies.
  • You work independently, effectively, plan systematically and take initiative.
  • You are communicative and have a positive can-do attitude.
  • Since you will be responsible for international recruitment, you are fluent in Dutch, English and French.
  • You are a people person. You enjoy being part of a team and sharing the information you come across. This also means you know how and when to maintain confidentiality.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of an innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot and challenge yourself to creatively shape the recruitment journey. Your colleagues understand your challenges,  will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • Spacewell promises continuous impact combined with an energetic workplace.
  • It is our mission to optimize building performances and improve the quality of life by delivering innovative software solutions on an international scale.
  • We strive to have a wider impact as an organization by being bold and ambitious. Next to that, all of our tools are linked to insights based on real data.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

results.title: Human Resources Business Partner Lead
results.description:
Company Description
Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

Our HR Business Partners (HRBP) support specific teams, working closely with management and employees on people-related issues: talent management, employee relations, coaching/development, compensation, conflict and performance management, organizational development and more. HRBPs are instrumental in initiating and driving HR programs and initiatives within specific functions.

We’re looking for a HRBP Lead to drive people and business initiatives across Square. You are someone who is interested in making a significant impact in our Customer Success organization and excels in a fast-paced, high engagement environment with extraordinary desire to innovate. You will work closely with business leaders to provide hands-on and strategic input, insight, and advice with respect to employee relations, performance management, coaching, compensation, conflict management, organizational development, training and more. You’re comfortable speaking up and driving initiatives forward despite any unexpected roadblocks. You will report to Square's HR Lead.  

You will:

  • Partner with mid-level management and senior executives to develop and implement effective HR policies and practices to support the strategic growth of the business
  • Provide HR expertise in the areas of compensation, feedback, performance management, employee relations, development and coaching, and organizational development
  • Offer thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution
  • Collaborate with the People team to champion and accelerate a culture of excellence in which people feel engaged and inspired to deliver top business results
  • Develop multi-year people strategies and design approaches for diagnosing and enhancing organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction
  • Lead core HR processes such as performance calibration, compensation cycle, promotions
  • Analyze and interpret various types of employee reports (eg, compensation, job levels, and attrition) to guide decision-making and provide proactive solutions to client groups
  • Partner with HRBP and Learning & Programs colleagues to work on value-added programs in areas of training, development, career mobility and job performance


Qualifications

You have: 

  • Minimum 8 years experience in HR and prior experience leading teams
  • Relevant experience building and improving company culture and increasing employee engagement, and expertise in performance management
  • Superb communication skills, including effective facilitation, listening and writing
  • Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills
  • Effective coaching and facilitation skills and ability to influence colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Knowledge of HR programs and practices, including applicable state and federal employment laws and regulations
  • Track record of strategic partnering with Customer Success and/or Go-to-market business leaders on multi-year company or org-wide people initiatives


Additional Information

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone A: USD $184,100 - USD $225,000
Zone B: USD $171,200 - USD $209,200
Zone C: USD $162,000 - USD $198,000
Zone D: USD $152,700 - USD $186,700

To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information. 

Benefits include the following:

  • Healthcare coverage
  • Retirement Plans including company match 
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance 
  • Paid parental and caregiving leave
  • Paid time off
  • Learning and Development resources
  • Paid Life insurance, AD&D. and disability benefits 
  • Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources 

This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. 

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page. 

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

results.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Manager (f/m/d)
results.description:
YOUR MISSION

We are looking for an experienced Senior Talent Acquisition Manager to help our company find and retain excellent employees. You will be entrusted with an ongoing quest to discover talent, build a strong employment brand and ensure great relationships with both candidates and employees. You'll also work on shaping our hiring processes and mentor other members of your team.

You'll be our first full-time member of our Talent Acquisition Team within the Tech department, working closely with Tech Leadership and HR.

To excel as Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, we expect you to be experienced in full-cycle recruiting and employment branding. You should have a sharp eye for talented people and a steady commitment to help them find success in our company. In the past you've managed talents successfully and will do so in a respectful, transparent and educative manner.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Determine current staffing needs and produce forecasts

  • Lead employment branding initiatives

  • Plan and conduct recruitment and selection processes (interviews, screening calls etc.)

Requirements

YOUR PROFILE

Proven experience as talent acquisition manager in a tech company

Benefits

WHY US?

results.title: Healthcare Recruiter
results.description:
Potential to earn $40,000-$120,000 in your first year with average recruiters making $120,000-$200,000 in the second year ($19.23/hour + Commission)!

As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host’s core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• Consistently meets and/or exceeds sales goals by driving new placements and retention of clinicians on assignment.

• Actively prospects, pre-screens and activates candidate leads through cold calling, email and text blasting. Identifies relevant open job opportunities that match the candidate’s specialty experience and professional interests.

• Understands clinician job requirements. Creates compelling candidate profiles for submission to hiring managers. Follows up daily on active candidate submissions and collaborates with account managers to ensure candidates move rapidly through the hiring process.

• Ensures interviews are scheduled and works with account managers to solicit assignment and extension offers on behalf of candidates. Able to pre-close and close offers with candidates to drive offer acceptance.

• Maintains strong rapport with clinicians on assignment to ensure a positive experience and actively drives assignment extensions and rebooking of clinicians at other facilities. Assists in resolving service or credentialing issues that may arise.

• Accurately enters all candidate and placement activity into the Host Healthcare database.


Qualifications:

• High school diploma required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

• Previous sales experience and/or healthcare knowledge preferred.

• Excellent verbal and written communications. Able to negotiate and problem-solve collaboratively with candidates and internal team members.

• Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Able to maintain an organized, well-run sales desk and meet required turnaround times. Comfortable within in a fast-paced work environment.

• High comfort level operating within technology platforms (e.g., Target Recruit)


Benefits and Compensation:

• Uncapped commission!

• Benefits on day 1 (medical, dental, vision) and company-paid life insurance; short and long-term disability; supplemental life insurance for yourself, spouse & child(ren); and multiple voluntary benefits [Hawaii residents receive benefits on the first day of the month following hire date!]

• Eligible for 401K after 6 months of hire - company match at 1 year!

• Remote work option - work from anywhere in the United States

• We provide your equipment (laptop, monitors, headset, etc.)

• Discounted gym memberships

• Flexible PTO

• 10 paid holidays

• Training programs for growth and development

• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

• Pet insurance - don't forget about our furry friends!
